website_summaries.verdict: While this push walker is a good option for babies under one, there are some better alternatives at a lower price.
pros: Has fun activities like flipping doors, beads, and a ball
Folds flat so it can be used by pre-walkers but that also makes it easier to store
cons: Lightweight and prone to tip over

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't seem like to will hold up to a baby and toddler ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very flimsy product, especially considering the price. It feels very cheap and lightweight. It doesn't seem like to will hold up to a baby and toddler pushing it around. The stickers to attach to the tabs do flip sections are already coming off and my baby hasn't even played with it yet. It is also very difficult to unlock - I've pinched myself several times trying to open or close it. I wish I had paid a few dollars more for the higher quality vtech walkers. This product does not live up to the quality you normally expect from Fisher Price.
customer_reviews.author: Am

customer_reviews.title: Great! ... 30 years ago
customer_reviews.text: There are much better alternatives these days. Very antiquated item. Limited entertainment value and very hard for child to use to learn to walk due to the loose, cheap plastic wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. MomTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: All in all its an excellent tool for the money
customer_reviews.text: Item is exactly as pictured/described. Doesn't have all the bells and whistles but after almost a week, my almost 11 months old loves it. He plays with the front part every day and he's learning to pull himself up by himself and push it around. Took some getting used to at first- we had a few wipeouts. All in all its an excellent tool for the money. I read some reviews saying it would topple over when kids grabbed it to pull up- that hasn't been out experience. My son is about 21 pounds (big boy) and the item is pretty sturdy. Great buy. He'll be walking within the next few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: its good as a sit-and-play toy
customer_reviews.text: Constantly flips over on our baby. She didn't use it until she could already walked because it scared her too much to learn on after all the falls. Stickers peeled off immediately, so don't put them on. Otherwise, its good as a sit-and-play toy.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Fisher-Price Bright Beginnings Activity Walker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a "starter" toy to help encourage my 9 1/2 month old granddaughter to walk more. She has had a great time with it. She constantly plays with the the interaction sections when she is not walking with (with the help of her parents or sister at this stage). She gives us all the biggest grin and claps in excitement with any steps she takes with it. I am so glad it was something she enjoys! When she's older, we plan to get another of this type of toy that has more interaction options.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia A Gibbons

customer_reviews.title: I love the simplicity of the activities in the front
customer_reviews.text: Even though my daughter has been walking for several months, she still loves to push this around. I purchased this particular one after noticing at her daycare that this model got a lot more use- even more then the newer looking ones with all the sounds and buttons. It seems to be much easier to use, and smoother to walk with. I love the simplicity of the activities in the front, and so does my daughter. Great price too!
customer_reviews.author: JessLyn

customer_reviews.title: FisherPrice things are always sturdy and seem to be just what I need
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these since I have triplet granddtrs. and thought that they would help with dexterity skills as well as learning to walk. FisherPrice things are always sturdy and seem to be just what I need. All 3 of the girls used these to transition from crawling to taking those first steps to going all over the house with them. Highly recommend! They all are in early walking stages now and still love this item.
customer_reviews.author: P. G.

customer_reviews.title: Very manuverable
customer_reviews.text: My daughter started using this around 7 months very efficiently. She learned quickly to turn it in full circles and would put her stuffed animals in the oval handle and push them around the house. It is light enough for my petite little girl to run with and the balance is spot on. She had another one given to her but it was back-heavy and she couldn't lean on it and fell a lot. She is 15 months now and doesn't need it, but she still like to grab it once in a while and run into peoples legs for a good reaction.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has been using this since she was 8 months. She loves it. The only thing I don't like is how light the end of this is. We needed to put a weight on the front of it as a counter balance because she was putting too much weight on the front and was falling over. Once we figured that out my daughter now plays with this all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Bly

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as it should be...
customer_reviews.text: Good starter for a baby learning to walk! I was not very impressed by the quality. The one leg would get stuck and I remember the first time I tried to open and close it I got very frustrated with it. Also, you need to be aware that it is very light so your baby will pull it over on themselves if they try to use it to stand. Either keep an eye on your child with it if they cannot free stand yet or wait to give it to them.
customer_reviews.author: Kerri

customer_reviews.title: but then just like that he got it
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit unsure based on some of the prior reviews, but brought this product to help my son starting walking/supporting himself with greater confidence. It didn't quick take off at first...but then just like that he got it! This has become one of my son's favorite toys and he's frequently running us down with this walker...and occasionally stops to play with the toys in front. I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, anything that doesn't require batteries in awesome. This toy is great. Its easy to clean and can transition through different developmental stages with your child. It also makes noise, but not enough noise to make you want to crack open the wine bottle early.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna Schavrien

customer_reviews.title: best 20 bucks we've spent in a long time.
customer_reviews.text: as new parents, it's hard to know what to buy, separating the necessary from the rest is hard to do sometimes. but when your baby decides he likes push toys, this little puppy does the trick! he loves pushing this thing around, and it's improves his balance and coordination. the only thing I didn't like is that the handle is a bit weak for strong children who bear down all their weight on it. my husband rigged it so he can't push the handle down to the shortest setting anymore but that's our only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: theshaks

customer_reviews.title: wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this toy! She loves walking with it and playing with the items on its front. Excellent product! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Baby does like to play with all the front functions
customer_reviews.text: Baby does like to play with all the front functions. She loves to stand up and walk with assistance...but there is no way to adjust the wheels to slow it down...which makes it a runaway train if unsupervised.
customer_reviews.author: mossarden

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I think I bought ours when Amazon was having the Fisher Price sale for around $12. My son loves it and I'm interested to see if it will be sturdy enough to hold up to him once he actually starts using it as a walker. It would be nice if there were some kind of locking mechanism on the wheels but we usually prop it against a wall so he can use it without it rolling away. For the price, this was a great purchase and keeps our son interested!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for unsteady steppers
customer_reviews.text: The product looks steady enough in the photos, but it is so light-weight that my nine-month-old could not steady herself beside it. She is just fine on sturdy furniture and can walk with you holding her hands, so I thought this would be great. She does love the bright colors and the toys on the side, and she can hold the handles quite easily. Some of the other brands seemed to have very fat handles that looked difficult for small hands to grasp. Maybe she will grow into it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: This was fun for about 2 days
customer_reviews.text: This was fun for about 2 days. It would be great for a lightweight baby but I have a tall, sturdy little fellow and this toy does not support him trying to walk. He liked playing with the toys when folded flat but definitely not safe to help learn to walk or support him pushing.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Favorite push toy
customer_reviews.text: Our toddler grandsons have many push toys but this one is by far their favorite. It is the only one they fought over, so we had to buy a second one! Now they enjoy racing! It is light weight yet very stable for them to walk behind. Before they walked, they enjoyed playing with its manipulatives but it was the first push toy they could successfully maneuver once they were walkers. I consider this toy a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy P.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This toy is perfect for a baby learning to walk. It's cheap, but super light, which makes it perfect for baby to maneuver around. My son zips all over the place w/ it; perfect for self-entertainment. It's also easy for transporting to the Grandparents' place
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift to my friend and his kid loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Ofuq

customer_reviews.title: Our baby granddaughter LOVES this walker, but ended up ...
customer_reviews.text: Our baby granddaughter LOVES this walker, but ended up walking so early that she doesn't need it to support her walking! We leave it at our house for her to play with when they visit. She turns a year old in Dec, 2016 and has been walking for a few weeks now. (10 months)
customer_reviews.author: C. L. Hornung

customer_reviews.title: He is a running
customer_reviews.text: My Son Loves this. The plastic wheels are great and transition well form carpet, to tile to concrete It can fold but its some times tricky to fold up. Only problem with this item is the stickers are not preset on the toy and they peel easy.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Lacava

customer_reviews.title: Great price considering how little both of my girls used ...
customer_reviews.text: Great price considering how little both of my girls used it. They loved it though and only really used it for balance for about a month each and then they stopped being interested in it. I would still recommend it to friends though because it cleans easily, can fold up and slide under a bed or crib, and can be used in a flat position if you want to.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie Wilson

customer_reviews.title: I gave four stars because it keeps baby balance but its light and not very sturdy my baby is small and he can easily turn ...
customer_reviews.text: my 11month old absolutely lovessss it he loves pushing it to walk and he is excited about the front as well. I gave four stars because it keeps baby balance but its light and not very sturdy my baby is small and he can easily turn it over while pushing it lol so i feel like i still have to follow him as he goes then again i'm a worrier lolol. This is a great buy baby will love it guaranteed!
customer_reviews.author: CSC

customer_reviews.title: My grandson loves it, but not a lot of toy for the money!!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't impressed with this item but my 10 month old grandson loves it. I bought him another walker at Amazon at Christmas for his house and for very close to the same amount of money, the first walker had a great deal of electronics and lights. It was much more entertaining than this walker. This is a very basic walker, I guess you would call this the "no frills" walker.
customer_reviews.author: sarah a slater

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: my daughter loves this walker! not only does she walk with it, but she loves playing with the activity center on the front!
customer_reviews.author: kaileejadee

customer_reviews.title: No noise
customer_reviews.text: My 12 month old granddaughter explored all the buttons and flaps on this toy, and it was obvious that she was disappointed that it did not play music or make noise. She has shown only mild interest in it as a walker, because she always ends up trying to push it from the front and then she steps on it. She might have enjoyed playing with it in the folded position when she was a little younger, but at 12 months, she's pretty bored with it.
customer_reviews.author: Grits53

customer_reviews.title: Not happy for early walker due to safety
customer_reviews.text: This walker is unsafe for the baby that is starting to learn to walk due to the fact that you cannot control the spinning of the wheels. If you could control the spinning the baby would have more control and this walker would not get away from the baby. I hope the manufacturer improves it by modifying the wheels in some way to control the spinning/turning of the wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Israel Segovia

customer_reviews.title: Great push toy, especially for getting places fast...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great push toy. My daughter was already pulling up when we got it, and it was not too light for her to get up and push it around. The spinning toys on the front are fun for her, too; she really enjoys spinning the ball and little flaps. She uses it every day, even after learning to walk independently - it helps her get across big distances very quickly. It is light enough that she is able to reposition it to move where she wants it to go, but it has never fallen on her, even on our laminate flooring.
customer_reviews.author: Dalena

customer_reviews.title: It is a great aid for learning to walk! I recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! My son started pulling himself up the day he turned 6mos and "cruises" around furniture so I got this to assist him with learning to walk independently and it is AMAZING! He pulls himself up on it, pushes/walks with it and it doesn't fall over(he is an average size 6mo old). We also have carpet and he is able to walk with it on the carpet smoothly with no problems at all. It comes already assembled and he loves to walk with it and play with the attatchments on the front! Best money I've ever spent on a baby "toy".
customer_reviews.author: Neema1490

customer_reviews.title: Great Choice for those close to learning to take steps.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best gift to give little ones who are learning to walk. It helps them take steps on their own while holding on to the push handle. It also folds down to be a play toy when they can just sit up and not take steps yet. Very useful for quite a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Kane

customer_reviews.title: New walking baby
customer_reviews.text: My son crawled right over to this and got involved. He investigated all the moving parts and then stood hanging on for a bit. On a mom note this was the easiest activity toy. I opened the box and it was already together. I had a few stickers to put on and that was it. It has snap and move features to adjust from a floor toy to a walking toy that are super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Bruin

customer_reviews.title: Love that you can fold this flat so i can bring it outside
customer_reviews.text: As a parent in NYC, my daughter has trouble practicing with her walker in our apt because she hits a wall or furniture every 3 steps. That's why i love this walker. I can fold it flat with ease, latch it on to my stroller and every weekend morning, we go to the turf-soccer field next to my apt and my daughter practices with her walker to her heart content. The laughter I hear as she enjoys her freedom is absolutely magical.
customer_reviews.author: NYC001

customer_reviews.title: great idea, but doesn't work most of the time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew who about a yr old and learning standing and walking. Thought this would help him with the walking, but the front is too light that it kept flipped backward causes him to lost balance and fell down everytime. He's a small boy for his age too, so it's not his size that causing the flip. Other stuffs on it look great and he played with it for a bit. After couple times, they put it away.
customer_reviews.author: dreamseeker

customer_reviews.title: a bit too lightweight but overall okay
customer_reviews.text: nice product for a walker had a heavier one for the other grand daughter which I like a bit better. this is a bit lightweight but its okay.
customer_reviews.author: D n B bikers

customer_reviews.title: Love this walker for the first year
customer_reviews.text: Baby can use it in the down position to play with the toys when s/he can sit up. When they get a little older, about 8-9 months, they can use it to help them cruise and learn to walk. There is not a seat or strap on it so you don't have to worry about them getting stuck on those. I buy this toy for first-time parents as a gift. My kids all got good use out of it and it's well-constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan and Jen

customer_reviews.title: Great Walking Toy
customer_reviews.text: My one year old grandson got this for his first birthday gift. He is beginning to walk . When he came to visit us he was walking around with this toy. He also walks around his house with it. It can be used as a walking toy or a toy on the floor like a busy box with several activities.
customer_reviews.author: Super Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Best walker on the planet
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic item to get your little one walking faster its very stable and light enough for even the smallest child to maneuver. Highly recommend when unit is laid down it provides fun for the child interacting with it. It folds flat enough to be slipped out of the way under a chair or sofa or bed
customer_reviews.author: USMC-0317

customer_reviews.title: Baby Walker
customer_reviews.text: My grandson is just learning to walk and I thought this would be a great help for him. The first time he used the walker he had the biggest smile on his face. He may not use it for a long time but it is definitely giving him confidence with the learning process. He also enjoys the toys on the front so it was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: K LTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product!
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to set up - just unfold, pop into place and apply decorative stickers. My 11 month old grandson loves to both get behind it and pull up and walk with it, and sit in front of it and play with all the little toys on the front. Oh, and when he falls and takes it down with him, he likes to spin the wheels when it's upside down.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy A.

customer_reviews.title: Not good for kids that are JUST learning to stand
customer_reviews.text: This walker is very light and unstable for a kiddo that doesn't have the cruising/pulling/standing skill set down. After my son pulled this over on himself a few times we put it away until he got better with his more stable motorcycle push toy.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole A.

customer_reviews.title: Simple But Fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 10 month old son when he started trying to walk. It was a wonderful gift for him, and he uses it daily, even now that he's nearly 14 months old and has been walking for months. My three year old also loves it, and he spends hours running through the house pretending it is a lawn mower, a vacuum, or a shopping cart. Truly fun for all kids.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Reed

customer_reviews.title: My grandson loves his. He pushes it around all ...
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves his. He pushes it around all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my great niece who is 9 months old and learning to walk. She likes to play with it but she is not ready to walk behind it yet. The child needs to be quite steady on her/his feet with good balance since the walker will scoot ahead causing the child to fall forward. Probably better to use on carpet rather than wood or vinyl flooring.
customer_reviews.author: Gizmo

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: My baby grand loves the bright colors. We haven't figured out a way to use it upright on these tile floors, though. She loves the rolling ball in the middle, and the flippers at the bottom. She's still trying to learn to turn the spinner, and isn't interested in the rest. I wish it came with something to put on the wheels to make them less slippery on hard surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: lucycmorr

customer_reviews.title: One bad thing
customer_reviews.text: Great to have baby walk alone without holding my hand. Builds confidence. Only bad thing is one wheel doesn't spin so it forces him to always go to the left and get stuck. Not sure if that's a defect on mine or meant to be that way to slow them down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still good
customer_reviews.text: It's a good product. It's just son never wanted to use for its intension. He just played with colorful stuff. But that's okay. It's still a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Angry Penguin

customer_reviews.title: Helps the kiddos walk!
customer_reviews.text: Our now 10-month-old son loves walking around with this, and it is helping him stabilize his walking for sure. I just wish it was a bit more sturdy and had a few more activities on the front. He gets bored with it. He has a different one at day care with more on the front that he prefers.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Still in great shape and will be passed on to another child
customer_reviews.text: He racked up the miles on this and then before long, he was walking! Really feel this toy helped in his development. And even after he was walking he found ways to play with it. Still in great shape and will be passed on to another child. Too bad all toys aren't made this well!
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Beware! Baby might fall forward it moves way too fast! Beware
customer_reviews.text: My baby is 10 months and starting to stand and try to walk, this toy is too light and she falls forward to easily. If it were heavier or the wheels had rubber and gripped it would be much better
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Keyser

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy push toy!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is still going strong after a year of hard play, my kids enjoy pushing it/running it around mostly, as the front activity center has as lost most of it's novelty.
customer_reviews.author: ItsAlwaysSunny

customer_reviews.title: Over all a good buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 10 month old grand daughter. She loves the toys on the front. I only wish that the front had a little heavier. It will flip backwards if baby starts to fall that way. Lucky for me she figured this out and is a lot more stable with it now. So use caution when your little one first uses it.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Slone

customer_reviews.title: my parents had one almost like this growing up and the grandkids still use it
customer_reviews.text: cheap feeling, my parents had one almost like this growing up and the grandkids still use it, it was quality, this thig is way cheaper, same company and you can see how quality has gone in the toilet over 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: JUtah

customer_reviews.title: but my daughter loved running behind it while banging into the walls
customer_reviews.text: A little pricey for the quality, but my daughter loved running behind it while banging into the walls. If I did it again I would get something like a shopping cart that she wouldn't have outgrown so quickly. Her interest in this toy didn't even last a week
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Brown

customer_reviews.title: Mine does like to play with it when it is folded down ...
customer_reviews.text: The walker does not weigh much at all so it doesn't help babies keep their balance. Mine does like to play with it when it is folded down though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't wait to see my grandson take his First Steps behind this walker!
customer_reviews.text: So happy to purchase a toy for my grandson, that isn't electric or battery operated! Perhaps the plastic quality isn't as durable as Little Tykes or Step Two though.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Nethercott

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: decent price. this was bought as a gift for an expectant mom
customer_reviews.author: osa

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful activity toy!
customer_reviews.text: My 9 month old granddaughter loves her activity walker. She plays with it both folded and as a walker. And my daughter-in-law loves that it is easy to fold and put away. A great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: L. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Both of my kids have loved this. I like that it's not electronic at ...
customer_reviews.text: Both of my kids have loved this. I like that it's not electronic at all so we can take it outdoors. It is a blast for a a new to walking baby on the beach!
customer_reviews.author: asiaelainer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for niece who is beginning to stand
customer_reviews.text: Perfect gift for niece who is beginning to stand. She loves playing with the activities.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: My grandson received this for his first birthday and really ...
customer_reviews.text: My grandson received this for his first birthday and really loves it. They take it to the ball park when his older brother plays baseball.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew's first bday and he loves it. He wasn't walking yet just standing or would walk with someone holding him but just 3 weeks after he was walking on his own. He finds it very entertaining and gets so excited he runs around the house with it. It's a very sturdy and safe. Some reviews mentioned the wheels weren't safe because they slip but my sisters home has shiny tile and even like that he's never slipped or had an accident so it's safe to use on my account. I definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: karlo

customer_reviews.title: Our grandson loved this and learned to walk with it
customer_reviews.text: Our grandson loved this and learned to walk with it! Doesn't slip out from under him like others have. A must for all babies!
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: This walker looks very nice but there are no brakes
customer_reviews.text: This walker looks very nice but there are no brakes. The walker went too fast and my son fell a couple of times. Unlike another walker that I bought after this that provided different levels to where you can it gives him some restraint so he wouldn't fall. I wouldn't recommed due to safety.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Grandaughters love it.
customer_reviews.text: This was a deal of the day that I got for my granddaughter's 2nd birthday. Once it was opened, she wouldn't play with anything else. Now her sister (9 mos. old) is using it to help her stand and walk. Typical Fisher-Price quality and durability means that it will last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: I. Hodge

customer_reviews.title: Watch them GO!!! It is great to help them walk!!
customer_reviews.text: When they are at the age they are holding your hands and walking, this is great. They just need a little help in the beginning and then watch them go. Or if they are younger they can sit and play with all the gadgets, it will keep them busy and help with their fine motor skills!!
customer_reviews.author: Patsi J. Stillo

customer_reviews.title: Child loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful toy, price great. Needed it for a present. What I liked a boy or girl can use it. Can be saved or given away when child out grows it.
customer_reviews.author: blaker14

customer_reviews.title: great buy!
customer_reviews.text: granddaughter took to this immediately and started walking; great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Miriam S. Medina

customer_reviews.title: Kind of fun. But not the best option
customer_reviews.text: It’s nice but there are other options out there that kept our babies much more engaged
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: slippery wheels on carpet and hardwood
customer_reviews.text: My son seems to have fun with it sitting on the floor but the wheels have too little grip to provide much of a walking aid to him (think putting furniture sliders on the legs of grandmas walker)
customer_reviews.author: D. Chestnut

customer_reviews.title: Good walker
customer_reviews.text: This was a good walker. My daughter pushed it around the house until she had steady footing, then promptly moved on to something else. She never had much interest in the gadgets on the front, so I can't say anything helpful about those parts. Not as useful as the walker/rider that FP puts out, but does its job well.
customer_reviews.author: Veggie Girl

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Baby loves it. He's 7 months old and has been walking using a chair or stool for about a month, so I thought I'd better get him a walking toy. He likes all the moving parts, and it moves at a good pace for him.
customer_reviews.author: Amberhhhh

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: I love it my baby loves the way everything moves. It's basic and simple. But it's new to babies
customer_reviews.author: Lay

customer_reviews.title: All in one teaching toy.
customer_reviews.text: This has so many teaching toys in one. Our grand daughter pushes it like a grocery cart. It has objects to teach counting, colors and some shapes.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: couple of bells or play some tunes and then our kids would love to learn to walk with this toy
customer_reviews.text: If this toy was a little more exciting with some lights and some noise makers then I think our son would play with it a bit more then he does. I bought this Activity Walker expecting him to learn to walk with it, but he doesn't seem to be all that interested in it yet and he is very close to walking on his own. If this toy were more interesting by catching their eyes then this Walker would be a total 5 star hit. Just add some bright lights, couple of bells or play some tunes and then our kids would love to learn to walk with this toy!
customer_reviews.author: Angeleque Orosco

customer_reviews.title: Fisher-Price Bright Beginnings Activity Walker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson for Christmas. I like how it will grow with him. He isn't walking yet but he can still play with the activites and when he does start walking he will be able to push the toy around and still get lots of use out of it. Good contruction, bright colors. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Studjugg

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: It's ok for the price. Can't really complain when all I paid for it was $14. For my older child I had a Chicco and I feel that one was way better quality than this one. This one fells cheaply made, but honestly at this age they out grow their toys so fast that it doesn't matter to me.
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: I have this in my daycare and I can't keep the 5 year olds away from it! They use it to chase each other ! Good lord! But the babies that this was intended for love it just as much. It's stable enough for the babies to pull themselves up and it rolls very easily! Definitely recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Beetlemoon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my son at around 10 months old and he still loves it at 19 months
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fisher-Price rules kids' (and parents') worlds!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for new walkers, but can be used even earlier, for it collapses to lay flat. Great for little hands, motor skill building and the "activities" are engaging.
customer_reviews.author: TINKERBELL2K

customer_reviews.title: It was almost identical to the "sister" of this activity walker.
customer_reviews.text: Because it was almost 100% the same as one someone else had given her, we did not open it on our recent visit. I suggested they take it to her child care provider and let her "share" it there. We don't get to see her very often due to travel distances.
customer_reviews.author: Sparksgal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for use at Grammy's house.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my grandson to use at our house, he pushes this all over the house when he visits.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy
customer_reviews.text: My 10 month old daughter loves this walker. She will play with it at some point every day. What we like about it is that there are no lights, batteries and loud noises. It's easy to put together and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: jknudse

customer_reviews.title: The product seemed fine at first
customer_reviews.text: Me and my friend bought it for her 1 year old son. The product seemed fine at first. But when he started to walk with it and put even slightest pressure on the handle, it folds all the way down. And baby would walk bended, every minute it need to be adjusted back up. I would not buy it or recommend it again!
customer_reviews.author: Sviatlana

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: Rolls a little too fast on tile for new walkers and it gets away from her but she can control it without any problems on carpet. She was 10 months when i bought it and is 1 week away from turning one and walks without it now but she still likes to push it around.
customer_reviews.author: Arijo's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter used this a lot, until she outgrew it.
customer_reviews.author: B. R. Stearns

customer_reviews.title: A 'must have' for every baby
customer_reviews.text: I feel like this is just a given, a must have for every baby. It is a great toy and walker when your kiddo is ready to test his balance. Both of mine loved it so I ordered this one as a gift for a friend having a baby.
customer_reviews.author: Kl12345

customer_reviews.title: My grandson LOVES this!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my grandson when he was 7 months, as he was trying to pull up on everything and stand with support. His attention was never grabbed by anything before this toy. He loves it!!! We don't let him stand with it too much because he still hasn't mastered the concept, but it's coming.
customer_reviews.author: Leanne M. McGriff

customer_reviews.title: My kiddo, who is just learning to walk, ...
customer_reviews.text: My kiddo, who is just learning to walk, loves this thing. Wish there was a way to lock the wheels though, so she could play with it while stationary.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Third kid and still fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: Had this same one from a garage sale for my oldest two kids. Helped them both learn to walk and had to find again for my youngest- and she loves it!
customer_reviews.author: B. Webster

customer_reviews.title: My 8-month old grandson really likes this toy. He ...
customer_reviews.text: My 8-month old grandson really likes this toy. He is starting to stand and this will help him to start walking.
customer_reviews.author: Donesha Pegues

customer_reviews.title: I also love that it's quiet (I got that for her parents' ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, my 7 month old niece loves it. I got it for her to grow into as she starts walking. She loves the toys on front now! I also love that it's quiet (I searched for something quiet for her parents' sake) and doesn't require batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: great item
customer_reviews.text: Our grandson liked the activity items on front more than using it to walk..but overall..its perfect size for,walking...rolls great.
customer_reviews.author: Nonita Miller

customer_reviews.title: it has much better toys. The Walker is a little top heavy ...
customer_reviews.text: Spend a few more $ on the vtech Walker, it has much better toys. The Walker is a little top heavy so it's easy for the baby to topple sideways.
customer_reviews.author: Nostradamus7

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this. She played with it before she could walk, but now that she is a confident walker she loves to push and drag it around the house banging into anything she can. Fun.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Learning Tool
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter has been playing with this since she was 6 months old. Lay flat on the floor and she would go at it. Now that she can walk, she is still enjoying this item which I think is great. Shapes and colors...getting them started early.
customer_reviews.author: dondon

customer_reviews.title: Granddaughter loves this walker!
customer_reviews.text: Our granddaughter pushes this walker all over her house. We bought it for her when she began showing signs of learning to walk at nine months, and this has been the perfect toy to help her gain stability as she now at ten months can walk independently.
customer_reviews.author: Karen H., Phillips

customer_reviews.title: 6 month old daughter loves this, but I wish ...
customer_reviews.text: 6 month old daughter loves this, but I wish the wheels could lock in place, for when she is just sitting and playing with it, but it is in its vertical position.
customer_reviews.author: RCar

customer_reviews.title: Built To Last
customer_reviews.text: Our baby loved learning to walk with this. Very minimal assembly required, and it withstands a lot of abuse including rain and rough play by older kids.
customer_reviews.author: G-Lanz

product_meta.title: Fisher-Price Bright Beginnings Activity Walker
product_meta.description:
The Fisher-Price Activity Walker offers plenty of hands-on, fine-motor-skill-building activities for baby to explore, including a bat-at roller ball, colorful beads to slide and spin, doors to flip, gears to turn…and more! Then as baby grows, it easily converts to a sturdy walker with a large, easy-grasp handle to steady baby’s first steps. with two grow-with-me ways to play! The walker folds flat for a sitting baby, with busy activities including flipping doors, sliding beads, turning gears, and spinning panels that baby can discover!

BRAND STORY
By

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
An infant walker that steady's baby's first steps and provides classic busy activities. Activities include flipping doors, sliding beads, turning gears, and spinning panels. In the center is a ball that spins. Walker folds for portability and storage.

See more
feature_bullets: Hands-on activities for sit & play fun
Converts to a sturdy walker to steady first steps
Busy activities including flipping doors, turning gears, sliding beads and more
